review: i was talked out of buying an Apple TV because this looked to do more for a third of the price. Google tells you it is sooo easy to set up. That's just a lie. I've been working on it for three hours now, and no luck. Google says it works on a mac, but the install failed on my mac. I got the install to work on my phone, but then the device lost the network. I rebooted my router, and the device found the network for a few seconds then lost it again. Neither my mac, nor my phone, nor my ipad can find the device. The online help from Google is pathetic, and it is clear from many sites that this is a well known problem that I guess Google thinks it isn't false advertising to pretend doesn't exist. The Google help provided is written in such technical jargon that you have to teach yourself what all the terms mean just to make sense out of it.  I also learned that the device only works on a limited technical spectrum of routers, including not working on newer 5mhz's. I've wasted a lot of time on this, and it doesn't work. Completely disappointed. Now I get to waste more time returning it. Do yourself a favor and buy something else.

review: This is my second attempt with the Google Chromecast.  The last time I had to return it because it was not compatible with my Kindle 7HD or anything else I owned.I now have a CHROMEBOOD ... so I bought it again.IT WORKS ... (I am so incompetent with this stuff, and I got it to work pretty easily).MY BIG REALIZATION ... there is no REMOTE CONTROL when using the Chromecast.I've had the Kindle Fire Stick for a while, and despite it's remote's shortcomings, at least it has one.BTW I jumped on a sale Chromebood ... and am really surprised how much I like it.  It doesn't do everything, but neither do I.It does all I need.  Shop (mostly amazon) and use google for everything.It weighs not much, and the battery life really is about 7 hours (at least).My laptop was on its last leg, and a Chromebood is certainly a budget friendly alternative, that I actually like MORE than my laptop.OF COURSE both Chromecast and Kindle and Kindle FIrestick .... are not 100% with its own proprietary makers.Not all Amazon apps/services work on Kindle Fire, and there is another glitch for some things with Fire TVSAME with GOOGLE.  Chromecast does not have full integration with ALL the Google Apps and Services.GO figure.  It would make too much sense for each to have totally proprietary systems that don't even fully work with all their own other variations on their systems.
